scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, the gang, except Rachel, is watching a new singer.]

dialogue.speaker: SINGER
dialogue.text: (singing) ‘Cause every time I see your face, I can’t help but fall from grace. I know.....

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Wow! This girl is good.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh-ho yeah! A song with rhyming words. Oo, I never thought of that before.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I like her.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) Why? Because she can sing and play guitar and do both at the same time?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, that’s pretty much all I’m looking for from these people.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) Look at you. All jealous.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah Pheebs, come on, you two have completely different styles. Y'know, she’s more..(shakes his shoulders, like he’s dancing) y'know, and you’re more (sees the look from Phoebe and stops)

dialogue.speaker: SINGER
dialogue.text: (singing) beside meeeee-eeee-ee. (everyone applauds her).

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, see, see, everyone else is happy she’s done.

dialogue.speaker: SINGER
dialogue.text: Okay, my next song’

dialogue.speaker: S CALLED
dialogue.text: Phoebe Buffay, What Can I Say. I Really Loved When We Were Singing Partners, And I Shouldn’t Have Left You That Way.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh no, one of those ‘look for the hidden meaning’ songs.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, the gang, except Rachel, is watching a new singer.]

events.event_description: The singer begins singing the song with lyrics about falling from grace upon seeing someone's face.
Joey expresses admiration for the singer, commenting that she is good.
Phoebe comments on the singer's use of rhyming words in her song.
Chandler states that he likes the singer.
Chandler sarcastically remarks that he looks for singers who can sing and play guitar at the same time.
Monica comments to Phoebe that she is jealous.
Ross explains to Phoebe that the singer's style is different from hers, mimicking dance moves.
The singer finishes her song and the group applauds her.
The singer announces her next song titled 'Phoebe Buffay, What Can I Say,' expressing her feelings about their past singing partnership.
Phoebe comments that the song is about looking for a hidden meaning.

dialogue.speaker: SINGER
dialogue.text: Hey Phoebe.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey Leslie, how’d you know I’d be here?

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: I ran into Vlad at the place where they sell the big fish, and he said you played here a lot, so umm....

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Ross) All right listen, I have to go to the bathroom, but if the place with the big fish comes up again. I’d like know whether that’s several big fish or just one big fish.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Leslie) So ah, Phoebe tells us you write jingles.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Actually I said she abandoned me to write jingles.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Leslie) Ah, anything we might of heard of?

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: Ah, yeah, umm. (singing) Home is never far away..

dialogue.speaker: AND JOEY
dialogue.text: (joining in) Home is Home Star stew.

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: Yeah, but, I don’t do that anymore. I got kinda sick of it, and then I couldn’t come up with anything good, so they fired me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hmm, bummer.

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: Well, I y'know, I was just, umm, I was just thinking and hoping, that umm, maybe you’d want to get back together?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No. But thanks.

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: Aw come on Phoebe would you just think about it?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. No. But thanks.

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: Okay, ah, see ya Pheebs. (leaves)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) Wow, that was kinda brutal.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well okay, let this be a lesson to all of you, all right. Once you, once you betray me, I become like the ice woman, y’know. Very cold, hard, unyielding, y'know nothing, nothing can penetrate this icy exterior. (to Monica) Can I have a tissue, please?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, sure.

events.event_description: Leslie greets Phoebe and explains how she learned Phoebe would be at Central Perk.
Chandler asks Ross about the big fish at the restaurant, indicating he wants to know if it's one or multiple fish.
Joey inquires Leslie if she has written any recognizable jingles, and Leslie sings a jingle he recognizes.
Leslie admits he was fired from his jingle-writing job due to creative difficulties.
Leslie asks Phoebe if she would consider getting back together with him, implying a previous relationship.
Phoebe declines Leslie's proposal to get back together, thanking him but firmly refusing.
Leslie leaves after their conversation, saying goodbye to Phoebe.
Joey comments on Leslie's rejection as 'kinda brutal'.
Phoebe describes her emotional state as 'the ice woman' after being betrayed, requesting a tissue from Monica.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Outside the bathroom, Chandler is pacing back and fourth, waiting is use it.]

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) Someone in there?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No. This is just part of a dare devil game that I play called ‘wait until the last moment before I burst and die.’

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Jeez, man did you fall..(sees it’s a beautiful woman coming out of the men’s room) Hi! So ah, did ya, did-did-did ya fall high?

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Someone was in the lady's room, I couldn’t wait. I left the lid up for ya though.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Gunther) Y'know what Gunther, go ah, go ahead, I’m-I’m talking to ah, (tries to get her to say her name). (to her) This is the part where you say your name.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Ginger.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ginger. I’m talking to Ginger, so....

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: Don’t you have to use the bathroom?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nope, nope, I’d just ah, I’d rather talk to you. (pause) Yes, I do. Yes, I do have to go to the bathroom. (knocks on the door)

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: Someone in here.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Outside the bathroom, Chandler is pacing back and fourth, waiting is use it.]

events.event_description: Chandler paces back and forth outside the bathroom, waiting to use it.
GUNTHER asks Chandler if someone is inside the bathroom.
Chandler responds that he is playing a daredevil game called 'wait until the last moment before I burst and die.'
Chandler notices a woman coming out of the men's room and greets her.
Chandler asks the woman if she fell high in the bathroom.
The woman explains she couldn't wait because someone was in the lady's room and mentions she left the lid up for Chandler.
Chandler asks Gunther to talk to the woman while he tries to get her to say her name.
Chandler prompts the woman to say her name, and she responds 'Ginger'.
Chandler introduces himself to Ginger and continues talking to her.
Chandler admits he needs to use the bathroom and knocks on the door.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, the gang’s putting their coats on to leave.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Where’s Chandler?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ah, he can’t make it, he said he had to his... (sees Ginger) Whoa-oh! (hides behind the coat rack.)

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: Joey? Joey Tribbiani?

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: Joey I can see you okay? You’re hiding behind the coats.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Phew, close one.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, the gang’s putting their coats on to leave.]

events.event_description: The gang prepares to leave Central Perk by putting on their coats.
PHOEBE asks where Chandler is.
JOEY responds that Chandler cannot make it and mentions he had to do something else.
JOEY notices Ginger and reacts with surprise, then hides behind the coat rack.
Ginger recognizes Joey and calls out to him, confirming her identity.
Ginger comments on Joey hiding behind the coats and sees him clearly.
Joey expresses relief that Ginger has seen him and is not hiding anymore.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Rachel’s office, Mark is packing his stuff into a box.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi, sweetie!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Hi, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, huh.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I’ve got some bad news.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I can get a quick bite to eat, but then I have to come back up here.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on sweetie! You’ve had to work late every night for the past two weeks, what is it this time?

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Actually, it’s kinda my fault. I-I quit today.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Rachel) But work comes first! (to Mark) Oh hey, but that’s sad about you though, what happened? Burn out? Burn all out, did ya?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Nooo, he’s leaving for a better job.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh well that’s great, so I guess this is ah, this is good bye then. Huh? (picks a pad up off Rachel’s desk and tosses it into his box) Good bye.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Okay, then.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well we’re gonna miss you around here.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Yeah, me too.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: So, see ya on Saturday.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, you bet.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Rachel’s office, Mark is packing his stuff into a box.]

events.event_description: Mark begins packing his belongings into a box in Rachel's office.
Rachel greets Ross with a cheerful 'Hi' in her office.
Ross responds to Rachel with a greeting, saying 'Hi'.
Rachel informs Ross that she has some bad news and needs to return to work shortly.
Ross questions Rachel about her need to leave early, noting her recent late work nights.
Mark admits to Ross that he quit his job today, taking responsibility for his decision.
Ross expresses concern that work comes first and comments on Mark's quitting, joking about burnout.
Rachel explains that Mark is leaving for a better job opportunity.
Ross acknowledges Mark's departure as a goodbye, picks up a pad from Rachel's desk, and tosses it into his box.
Mark says farewell, indicating he will see everyone on Saturday.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe and Monica are playing with a Ouija board,
Phoebe’s beeper goes off and Monica screams.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh. (takes her beeper puts in a pot, covers it, and puts the pot in the oven)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know those are a delicacy in India.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, that was Leslie calling again to see if we can get back together. That’s the twentieth time today! And good luck Leslie!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow, she must have hurt you pretty bad, huh?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, yeah. Y'know, we were best friends, ever since we were little, our Moms worked on the barge together.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, you two must have been so cute running around on a barge.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You never run on a barge!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE AND MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Is ah, is Chandler around?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, umm, he met some girl at the coffee house.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oooh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, Ginger something.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nooo. No, no, ah, are you sure it wasn’t something that sounded like Ginger, like ah, Gingeer?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, it was Ginger. I remember, because when he told me, I said, (singing) ‘the movie star.’

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Aww, man. That’s the girl I was hiding from. When she finds out he’s my roommate, she’s gonna tell him what I did.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, what did you do?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What, oh, oh, oh, no, no, I can’t, I can’t tell you that, it’s like the most awful, horrible thing I’ve ever done my whole life.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know what, don’t tell us. We’ll just wait until Chandler gets home, (to Phoebe) because it’ll be more fun that way.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right!! Okay, it was like four years ago. Okay, Ginger and I had gone out a few times, and then this one weekend, we went up to her Dad’s cabin. Just me, her, and her annoying little dog Pepper. Well that night, I cooked this really romantic dinner....

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You gave her food poisoning!?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I wish. No. After dinner, me, her, and Pepper all fell asleep in front of the fire. Well I woke up in the middle of the night and I saw that the fire was dying out. So, I picked up a log and threw it on. Or, at least what I thought was a log.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God!! You threw Pepper on the fire!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I wish. See, I guess another thing I probably should’ve told you about Ginger is that she kinda has a ah, artificial leg.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God! Joey, what did you do after you threw her leg on the fire?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I ran!!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe and Monica are playing with a Ouija board,
Phoebe’s beeper goes off and Monica screams.]

events.event_description: Phoebe takes her beeper, puts it in a pot, covers it, and places the pot in the oven.
Phoebe mentions Leslie calling repeatedly to get back together.
Monica comments that Leslie's calls suggest she hurt Phoebe.
Phoebe explains her friendship with Leslie and their mothers working together on a barge.
Monica jokes that Phoebe and Leslie must have been cute running around on a barge.
Joey enters the scene and asks if Chandler is around.
Monica informs Joey that Chandler is at the coffee house with a girl named Ginger.
Joey speculates that the girl's name might sound like Ginger, such as Gingeer.
Monica confirms the girl's name is Ginger and recalls telling Chandler 'the movie star' when he mentioned her.
Joey reveals he is hiding from Ginger because she will find out he is his roommate and tell Chandler.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A street, Chandler is kissing Ginger.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, that’s the best kiss I’ve had with anyone I’ve ever met in a men’s room.

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: Actually, me too.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (sees her foot is in a slush puddle) Op, foot in a puddle, foot all in a puddle.

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: Oh damn, I hate that.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, we’re gonna have to get you out of those shoes.

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: Oh, don’t worry about it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, really you’re gonna freeze.

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: No, I’m not.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You’re not, what do you, what do you got a bionic foot?

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: Some day, maybe.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A street, Chandler is kissing Ginger.]

events.event_description: Chandler kisses Ginger on the street.
Chandler comments that it is the best kiss he's had in a men's room.
Ginger responds that she also considers it the best kiss she's had.
Chandler notices Ginger's foot is in a slush puddle.
Chandler points out Ginger's foot is in a puddle.
Ginger expresses dislike for having her foot in the puddle.
Chandler suggests removing Ginger from her shoes to prevent her from freezing.
Ginger declines Chandler's suggestion to remove her shoes.
Chandler insists that Ginger will freeze if she doesn't get out of her shoes.
Ginger jokes about having a bionic foot someday.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Ross’s bedroom, Rachel getting into bed while Ross is reading and laughs.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Funny book?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hmmm. Oh, no, no, I just thinking about something funny I heard today. Umm, Mark, Mark saying ‘I’ll see you Saturday.’

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, at the lecture, I told you that last week, you said you didn’t mind.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, no, no, no, it’s-it’s not the lecture ah, I mind, umm....

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, please tell me it’s not because I’m going with Mark.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, well...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God!!! Ross!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I’m sorry, but ah, look if you’re not working with him anymore, why do you have to still do stuff with him?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Because, he’s my friend.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, but do you really need another friend? I mean...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, well if I stop playing with Joey and Chandler, can I play with Mark?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Is that funny? Am I supposed to be laughing?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don’t know, you thought ‘See you Saturday’ was funny. Look honey, Mark is in fashion okay, I like having a friend that I can share this stuff with. You guys would never want to go to a lecture with me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Pa-haa!! I would love to go with you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Really!?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, hey I-I have clothes, I even pick them out. I mean for, for all you know I could be a fashion..... monger.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay. Honey, I would love for you to go with me. (Ross has a worried look on his face) What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What should I wear, now I’m all nervous.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Ross’s bedroom, Rachel getting into bed while Ross is reading and laughs.]

events.event_description: Rachel gets into bed while Ross is reading on his bed.
Ross laughs after Rachel comments on his book.
Ross explains he is thinking about something funny he heard today involving Mark.
Rachel questions if Ross's laughter is about her and Mark's plans to meet on Saturday.
Ross admits he minds about Mark and Rachel's plans to meet on Saturday.
Rachel expresses frustration and questions if Ross's concern is because she is going with Mark.
Ross questions why Rachel still does things with Mark if she is no longer working with him.
Rachel states she still spends time with Mark because he is her friend.
Ross questions if Rachel needs another friend and jokes about being a fashion monger.
Rachel agrees to let Ross accompany her to the lecture, and Ross expresses nervousness about what to wear.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is looking at her beeper still in the pot. She
takes it out, shakes it, and puts it back in.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know they say a watched pot never beeps.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: It’s just y'know, been a couple of hours, and she hasn’t called. Not that I even care, y'know.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Phoebe why don’t you just call her? You obviously want to.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You think you know me so well.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, don’t ‘cha wanna?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, well I do know you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That’s what I said.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well so?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I can’t. I can’t. She dumped me, I mean I totally trusted her and then one day it was ‘Okay, bye Pheebs’ gone. Y'know what the saddest part is, when we were playing together, that was like the most fun I’ve ever had in like all my lives.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is looking at her beeper still in the pot. She
takes it out, shakes it, and puts it back in.]

events.event_description: Phoebe takes her beeper out of the pot, shakes it, and puts it back in.
Monica suggests to Phoebe that she should call her friend since she wants to know if she called.
Phoebe responds defensively, implying she knows Monica well and that she doesn't want to call her friend.
Monica encourages Phoebe to call her friend, asserting she knows her well.
Phoebe agrees to call her friend.
Phoebe reveals she is upset because her friend dumped her after trusting her, and she reflects on their past fun together.

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: (singing) My best shoes, so good to me. I wear them everyday. Down at the heel, holes in the toes. Don’t care what people say. My feet’s best friends, pals to the end. With them I’m one hot chicky. Though late one night, not much light, I....

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (singing) I stepped in something icky.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE AND LESLIE
dialogue.text: (singing) Sticky shoes, sticky shoes, always make me smile. Sticky shoes, sticky shoes, next time I’ll.... avoid the..... pillleeeee.

events.event_description: Leslie begins singing her song about her shoes at Central Perk.
Leslie sings the line about wearing her shoes every day and having holes in the toes.
Phoebe joins Leslie in singing, adding her line about stepping in something icky.
Phoebe and Leslie sing together about sticky shoes making them smile.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The lecture, Rachel is listening closely, Ross is bored out of his mind.]

dialogue.speaker: LECTURER
dialogue.text: We’re beginning to see a lot of layering of sheer fabrics and colours. For instance a sheer navy blouse over a pink....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Rachel) I’m really glad we came. (Rachel smiles and rubs his arm) You’re so pretty. I love you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh. (puts her hand over his mouth)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The lecture, Rachel is listening closely, Ross is bored out of his mind.]

events.event_description: The lecturer begins discussing the layering of sheer fabrics and colors in fashion.
Rachel listens closely to the lecture.
Ross expresses to Rachel that he is glad they attended the lecture.
Rachel smiles and rubs Ross's arm in response to his comment.
Ross compliments Rachel by saying she is pretty and expressing his love for her.
Rachel reacts to Ross's compliment by saying 'Oh' and covering his mouth with her hand.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is teaching Leslie how to sing Smelly Cat.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (singing) Smelly cat, smelly cat, what are they feeding you? Smelly cat, smelly cat, it’s not your fault.

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: Wow, that’s great.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah!

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: Y'know you could totally sell this. It’d be perfect for like umm, a kitty litter campaign.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I..., a jingle? No, no-no-no, no.

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: What? Why not? You could make a ton of money.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, well if I was in this for the money, I’d be a millionaire by now, y'know. You just got to get out of that jingle head sweetie.

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: Aw, you’re right, you’re right. I’m sorry.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That’s okay. All right, I’m gonna play song that’s really, really sad. It’s called Magician Box Mix Up. (she turns her guitar upside down to play it.)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is teaching Leslie how to sing Smelly Cat.]

events.event_description: Phoebe sings 'Smelly Cat' to Leslie at Central Perk.
Leslie compliments Phoebe on her singing.
Leslie suggests that Phoebe could sell her song for a commercial.
Phoebe declines the idea of making a jingle for money.
Leslie encourages Phoebe to consider earning money from her music.
Phoebe justifies her singing as not being motivated by money.
Leslie apologizes to Phoebe for suggesting she sell her song.
Phoebe announces she will play a sad song called 'Magician Box Mix Up' and turns her guitar upside down to play it.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The lecture, Ross is passed out against Rachel’s shoulder.]

dialogue.speaker: LECTURER
dialogue.text: ....oversized bracelets, oversized earrings, oversizing of accessories in general are very popular now.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The lecture, Ross is passed out against Rachel’s shoulder.]

events.event_description: Ross passes out against Rachel’s shoulder during the lecture.
The lecturer discusses the popularity of oversized accessories.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is reading the newspaper.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, can I borrow this? (points to his milk) My milk’s gone bad.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, I hate that. I once had a thing of half and half, stole my car.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So umm, how was your date with Ginger?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Great. It was great. She’s ah, she’s great, great looking, great personality, she’s greatness.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Sounds like she’s got the ah, whole package.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Joey told you about the leg, huh?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh God, it freaked me out. Okay, I know it shouldn’t have, but it did. I mean I like her, I don’t want to stop seeing her, but every so often it’s like ‘Hey, y'know what, where’s your leg?’ I mean I’m the smallest person in the world aren’t I? I’m the smallest person in the world.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering from his bedroom) Morning.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Actually he’s the smallest person in the world.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) Heard about the leg burnin’ huh?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It came up.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Listen, I ah, I know it’s a longshot. But, by any chance did she find that funny?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is reading the newspaper.]

events.event_description: Chandler reads the newspaper at Chandler and Joey's apartment.
Monica enters the apartment and asks to borrow Chandler's milk.
Chandler expresses dislike for having his half and half stolen, joking that it stole his car.
Monica asks Chandler about his date with Ginger.
Chandler describes Ginger as great looking with a great personality, emphasizing her overall greatness.
Monica comments that Ginger seems to have the whole package.
Chandler reveals Joey told Monica about Ginger's leg.
Chandler expresses discomfort about Ginger's leg, feeling self-conscious about his own size.
Joey enters the apartment and greets everyone.
Joey asks Chandler if Ginger found his comment about her leg funny, implying concern about her reaction.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are getting back from the lecture.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) So I nodded off a little.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Nodded off!! Ross you were snoring. My father’s boat didn’t make that much noise when it hit rocks!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on! Forty-five minutes! Forty-five minutes the man talked about strappy backed dresses.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well okay, how about four hours in a freezing museum auditorium listening to Professor Pitstains and he’s ‘Hey everybody! Remember that thing that’s been dead for a gazillion years. Well there’s this little bone we didn’t know it had!’

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: First of all it’s Professor Pittain! And second of all, that little bone, proved that, that particular dinosaur had wings, but didn’t fly.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, see now,

dialogue.speaker: WHAT I JUST HEARD
dialogue.text: blah-blah-blah, blah-blah-blah-blah-blah, blah-blah-blah, blah, blah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Y'know what, 100 million people went to see a movie about what I do, I wonder how many people would go see a movie called, Jurassic Parka.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, that is so...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No-no-no, a bunch of out of control jackets take over an island. (Makes an unusual sound, then he realises that he still has his jacket on and quickly tries to shake it off, thinking it’s alive and attacking him.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Y'know if what I do is so lame, then why did you insist on coming with me this morning? Huh? Was it so I just wouldn’t go with Mark?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No. I... I wanted to be with you. I don’t know, I feel like lately, I feel like you’re slipping away from me, y'know. With this new job, and all these new people, and you’ve got this whole other life going on. I-I-I know it’s dumb, but I hate that I’m not a part of it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: It’s not dumb. But, maybe it’s okay that you’re not a part of it. Y'know what I mean? (Ross looks confused) I mean it’s like, I-I-I like that you’re not involved in that part of my life.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That’s a little clearer.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Honey see, it doesn’t mean that I don’t love you. Because I do. I love you, I love you so much. But my work it’s-it’s for me y'know, I’m out there, on my own, and I’m doing it and it’s scary but I love it, because it’s mine. I, but, I mean is that okay?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Sure, I-I-I... (hugs her and mouths No!!)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are getting back from the lecture.]

events.event_description: Ross enters the scene and admits he nodded off during the lecture.
Rachel accuses Ross of snoring and compares it to her father's boat hitting rocks.
Ross complains about the lecture lasting forty-five minutes about dresses.
Rachel describes her experience of listening to Professor Pittstains for four hours in a freezing museum auditorium.
Ross corrects Rachel's pronunciation of Professor Pittstains and explains the significance of a bone in dinosaur research.
Ross jokes about a movie called 'Jurassic Parka' about out-of-control jackets taking over an island.
Ross realizes he is still wearing his jacket, which he thought was attacking him, and tries to shake it off.
Rachel questions Ross about why he insisted on coming with her in the morning, implying concern about his motives.
Ross confesses he wanted to be with Rachel and expresses concern about her drifting away due to her new job and social life.
Rachel reassures Ross that her love for him remains, explaining her need for independence in her work.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Ginger are eating dinner.]

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: Your thinking about my leg aren’t you?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No. No. Actually I forgot, what is the deal with that again?

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: It’s okay if it bothers you. Really. I mean t

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No. No. I don’t think so.

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: Okay. It’s just like anything else, you just have to get used to it.

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: What’s that?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That’s-that’s my nubbin.

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: What’s a nubbin?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It’s kinda a ah, a third nipple kinda thing.

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: You have three nipples?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, y'know two regulars. And ah one that barely qualifies as... (starts to kiss her again, but she gets up.) Ahh, what?

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: Nothing. I, I just remembered I have to leave.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You ah, you have, you have to leave, now? How come?

dialogue.speaker: GINGER
dialogue.text: Ah well, it’s nubbin. Nothing! Umm. Y'know what, I’ll see you later. Okay. (She leaves and in the hall we see her shake her shoulders like when someone runs their fingernails across a blackboard.)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Ginger are eating dinner.]

events.event_description: Ginger questions Chandler if he is thinking about her leg.
Chandler responds that he forgot the deal with Ginger's leg.
Ginger reassures Chandler that it's okay if her leg bothers him.
Chandler denies that her leg bothers him.
Ginger comments that getting used to her leg is similar to anything else.
Chandler points out his nubbin, a third nipple-like feature.
Ginger asks Chandler what a nubbin is.
Chandler explains that a nubbin is like a third nipple.
Ginger expresses surprise that Chandler has three nipples.
Ginger decides to leave abruptly after a brief exchange about her nubbin.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is getting ready to sing as Leslie enters.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Leslie) Oh, I thought you weren’t coming. What? Where were you?

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: Come here, come here. (they go to the side of the stage) Okay, don’t get mad, okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, don’t give me a reason to get mad, okay

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: I played Smelly Cat for the people at my old ad agency, they went nuts.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, look, I told you that I didn’t want you to try and sell it, and you just, you big fat did it anyway. God, y'know what, I think five years ago I probably would’ve done anything to play with you but, I can do it by myself. And if I can’t trust you then just forget it.

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: No, no, I don’t want to forget it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay y'know what you have to choose. All right, if-if the most important thing on the planet to you is this cat poopy thing then, okay you can have Smelly Cat, but we won’t be partners. So what’s it gonna be?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is getting ready to sing as Leslie enters.]

events.event_description: Leslie enters Central Perk and approaches Phoebe at the stage side.
Leslie tells Phoebe not to get mad and asks her to come closer.
Leslie confesses that she played 'Smelly Cat' for her old ad agency and that they went nuts over it.
Phoebe expresses her disapproval of Leslie trying to sell 'Smelly Cat' and states she can perform alone.
Phoebe states that if she cannot trust Leslie, they should stop being partners.
Phoebe gives Leslie an ultimatum: choose between 'Smelly Cat' and their partnership.
Leslie responds that she does not want to forget about 'Smelly Cat'.
Phoebe insists Leslie must choose between her and 'Smelly Cat'.
Phoebe states that if Leslie chooses 'Smelly Cat', they will no longer be partners.
Phoebe asks Leslie what her decision will be.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe, Monica, and Joey are watching TV.]

dialogue.speaker: COMMERCIAL
dialogue.text: (in the background their singing Smelly Cat) Problem odour in the litter box? Don’t change your kitty, change your kitty litter.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Sorry, Pheebs.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah. You okay?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah. I actually am, yeah. Y'know life-life’s gonna had you all kinds of stuff, y'know you learn your little lessons and hopefully you grow. Wanna hear a new song?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We’d love too.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. (singing) ‘Jingle bitch screwed me over! Go to hell jingle whore! Go to hell Go to hell. Go to hell-hell-hell.’ That’s all I have so far.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe, Monica, and Joey are watching TV.]

events.event_description: Commercial plays a jingle about kitty litter in the background while the characters are watching TV.
Monica apologizes to Phoebe for something she did.
Joey asks Phoebe if she is okay.
Phoebe responds that she is okay and reflects on life lessons.
Phoebe offers to sing a new song.
Joey expresses interest in hearing Phoebe's new song.
Monica agrees to listen to Phoebe's song.
Phoebe begins singing her new song with explicit lyrics.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the whole gang except Chandler is there.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (entering, happily) Well hello!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Where have you been?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: The doctor.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Is everything okay?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh yes! Just had me a little nubbin-ectomy. Yep! Two nipples, no waiting.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow! It’s like Rachel in High School.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Come on! Come on, I was kidding! It was such an obvious joke!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That was an obvious joke, and I didn’t think of it. Why didn’t I think of it? The source of all my powers. Oh dear God, what have I done!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the whole gang except Chandler is there.]

events.event_description: Chandler enters Monica and Rachel's apartment, greeting happily.
Joey asks Chandler where he has been.
Chandler responds that he was at the doctor.
Ross asks Chandler if everything is okay.
Chandler explains he had a 'nubbin-ectomy' and makes a joke about nipples.
Monica comments that Chandler's joke is similar to a high school joke about Rachel.
Rachel reacts with surprise or confusion to Monica's comment.
Monica clarifies that her previous comment was a joke and calls it obvious.
Chandler questions why he didn't think of the joke and expresses concern about his powers.
Chandler exclaims in distress about what he has done.
